gurmukhi: KwNf GiRq cUn jl pwvk iekqR Bey pMc imil pRgt pMcwmRq pRgws hY
transliteration: Khaand Ghrit Choon Jal Paavak Ikatr Bhaay , Panch Mili Pragat Panchaamrat Pragaas Hai ?
translation: As coming together of sugar, clarified butter, flour, water and fire produces elixir like Karhah Parshad;

gurmukhi: miRgmd gaurw coAw cMdn kusm dl skl sugMD kY Argjw subws hY
transliteration: Mrigamad Gauraa Choaa Chandan Kousam Dala , Sakal Sougandh Kai Aragajaa Soubaas Hai ?
translation: As all aromatic roots and materials like musk, saffron etc. when mixed produce scent.

gurmukhi: cqur brn pwn cUnw Aau supwrI kwQw Awpw Koie imlq AnUp rUp qws hY
transliteration: Chatur Baran Paan Choonaa Au Soupaaree Kaadaa , Aapaa Khoi Milat Anoop Roop Taas Hai ?
translation: As betel nut, betel leaf, lime and catechu lose their self-existence and merge with each other to produce a deep red colour more attractive than each one of them;

gurmukhi: qYsy swDsMgiq imlwp ko pRqwpu AYso swvDwn pUrn bHm ko invws hY ]124]
transliteration: Taisay Saadhasangati Milaap Ko Prataapu Aiso , Saavadhaan Pooran Braham Ko Nivaas Hai ?124?
translation: So is the praise of the holy congregation of saints blessed by the True Guru. It drenches everyone with such hue of Naam Ras that it opens the path for mergence into the Lord. (124)
